p: Several mechanistic and statistical disease modeling approaches have been employed to project the future distribution of dengue. 35, 113, 117, 118, 119, 120 These studies generally project an increase in the overall burden of dengue, but a clear consensus is lacking regarding regions of the world where transmission is expected to intensify and expand or contract and diminish. 101 A recent study highlights that future climate conditions might become increasingly suitable for dengue transmission in southern Europe in the summer. 121 Recent projections carried out for chikungunya show increasingly suitable climatic conditions in temperate regions of Western Europe (France, the Benelux Union, and Germany) for the future. 122, 123 The expected increase in urbanization (especially in urban slums) and increasing trends in international trade and travel must be expected to amplify, rather than reduce, future temperature effects on these diseases. 31
